intro: Callicarpa borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking purple-red berries that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and can reach heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for various wildlife species.
